The Better Bend Foundation

I am Gideon Parcel, former staircase salesman and current executive director. After my left knee made a noise like a snapped violin string in aisle seven of a carpet warehouse, I founded this organization to defend every citizen betrayed by hinge-based anatomy.

Today in our inbox

Subject: "My yoga instructor said knees are natural. Is this disinformation?"

Yes. We have dispatched a pamphlet and a calm attorney.

Hotline: 1-800-NO-KNEES (open during business hours and dramatic weather)

Mission statement

We are serious, oddly specific, and very sincere

We are a registered non-profit that offers legal representation, mobility-rights education, and policy advocacy for people harmed by environments that demand unnecessary bending, kneeling, crouching, and stair theatrics.

  • Free legal consults for low-income clients with joint-related injury claims.
  • Advocacy packets for schools, transit agencies, and overconfident gym chains.
  • Emergency transport vouchers for court dates in multi-level buildings.

Bulletin

From our newsroom: Municipal victory in North Harrow

The city council voted 8-1 to retire punitive stair-only permit offices. The lone "no" vote cited "tradition" and wore novelty knee pads. Our response remains civil.

Blog

Founder diary: The escalator that changed my life

I was 34, carrying sample carpet, and trying to look confident in loafers. The escalator failed. My knee objected in three languages. Two weeks later, this foundation was incorporated and my mother said, "Finally, a useful obsession."

FAQ

Questions I receive weekly

Do you hate knees?

No. We hate the social expectation that everyone should trust them without legal backup.

Are you a law firm or a non-profit?

We are a non-profit legal foundation. We provide direct services and partner with licensed firms in each jurisdiction.

Can healthy people support this work?

Absolutely. Knees are currently a universal warranty risk.

Why is every brochure signed by "Gideon"?

Because I wrote them at 2:00 AM after reading yet another "deep squat challenge" article.
